articles.headline: My Smartphone Died, and I Didn’t Miss It. Well, Maybe a Little.
articles.snippet: A trip to Italy with a dead smartphone resulted in some predictable withdrawal pains, but also provided welcome respite from the clutter of information.
articles.abstract: A trip to Italy with a dead smartphone resulted in some predictable withdrawal pains, but also provided welcome respite from the clutter of information.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, my smartphone shut down because of a low battery as I was about to board a flight to Europe. That seemed odd, given that I had barely used it that day. I plugged it in on the plane, but seven hours later, it still wasn’t functioning. When I arrived at my hotel I tried a different charger, to no avail. The phone was dead — terminally so, it turned out.

articles.headline: Without Saying ‘Trump,’ Bush and Obama Deliver Implicit Rebukes
articles.snippet: George W. Bush and Barack Obama emerged from political seclusion and denounced the politics of division, sending a message to their successor in the White House.
articles.abstract: George W. Bush and Barack Obama emerged from political seclusion and denounced the politics of division, sending a message to their successor in the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: Neither of them mentioned President Trump by name but two of his predecessors emerged from political seclusion on Thursday to deliver what sounded like pointed rebukes of the current occupant of the Oval Office and the forces of division that propelled him to power.

articles.headline: A Boom in Credit Cards: Great News for Banks, Less So Consumers
articles.snippet: Card debt has soared to record levels, generating big profits for banks but leaving some people with unmanageable payments.
articles.abstract: Card debt has soared to record levels, generating big profits for banks but leaving some people with unmanageable payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: Udean Murray, a 62-year-old retired telephone operator in Brooklyn, relies on more than a dozen credit cards to make ends meet. Her prescription medication often goes on a Capital One card. She pays for groceries with one from Discover Financial Services.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Stacy Cowley

articles.headline: Lyft Is Said to Explore I.P.O. as It Raises $1 Billion Led by Alphabet
articles.snippet: The ride-hailing company is exploring a 2018 initial public offering, as it added fresh capital to its coffers from investors including a venture arm spun out of Google.
articles.abstract: The ride-hailing company is exploring a 2018 initial public offering, as it added fresh capital to its coffers from investors including a venture arm spun out of Google.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In an escalation of its ride-hailing war against Uber, Lyft has begun to explore going public in 2018 and is trying to strengthen its position by raising more capital, including $1 billion in new financing led by an investment arm of Google’s parent company.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Katie Benner

articles.headline: Australia’s Amazon Book Battle
articles.snippet: The online retailer is moving in. Booksellers are nervous. But disrupting Australians’ reading habits might not be so easy to do.
articles.abstract: The online retailer is moving in. Booksellers are nervous. But disrupting Australians’ reading habits might not be so easy to do.
articles.lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia — When Borders opened in 2002 across the street from Readings, Melbourne’s best-known independent bookseller, retail experts predicted catastrophe for the musty old shop competing with the shiny new chain store.

articles.headline: Kelly Delivers Fervent Defense of Trump Call to Soldier’s Widow
articles.snippet: This week’s dispute over President Trump’s phone call to the widow of a soldier killed in Niger hit too close to home for the White House chief of staff.
articles.abstract: This week’s dispute over President Trump’s phone call to the widow of a soldier killed in Niger hit too close to home for the White House chief of staff.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, delivered a searing, personal defense of President Trump’s phone call this week to the widow of a slain Army soldier, describing on Thursday the trauma of learning about his own son’s death in Afghanistan and calling the criticism of Mr. Trump’s condolences unfair.

articles.headline: Bomb School Wasn’t for Lulu, but the C.I.A. Wishes Her the Best
articles.snippet: Meet Lulu, the black Labrador and free spirit who bucked expectations and flunked out of the C.I.A.’s explosive detection “puppy class.”
articles.abstract: Meet Lulu, the black Labrador and free spirit who bucked expectations and flunked out of the C.I.A.’s explosive detection “puppy class.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Let’s just get this out of the way: There are other matters of consequence going on in the world.

articles.headline: Puerto Ricans Ask: When Will the Lights Come Back On?
articles.snippet: A month after Hurricane Maria knocked out power, 80 percent of Puerto Rico remains without electricity. And progress is slow.
articles.abstract: A month after Hurricane Maria knocked out power, 80 percent of Puerto Rico remains without electricity. And progress is slow.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAGUAS, P.R. — Luis Rodríguez looked at the huge concrete power pole in his front yard, resting on his daughter’s Chevrolet and blocking the tow truck he drives to make a living, and wondered: When is help coming?
articles.byline: By Deborah Acosta and Frances Robles

articles.headline: The Long Story of the Movement Toward College Cost Clarity
articles.snippet: New bipartisan bills are aimed at forcing colleges to clear up a murky, confusing system so that prospective students understand the options.
articles.abstract: New bipartisan bills are aimed at forcing colleges to clear up a murky, confusing system so that prospective students understand the options.
articles.lead_paragraph: Once upon a time, paying for college was a relatively simple task.

articles.headline: Regulator Blasts Wells Fargo for Deceptive Auto Insurance Program
articles.snippet: A federal regulator’s report added to pressure on Wells Fargo and suggested that the bank will have to set aside more money to pay back customers it harmed.
articles.abstract: A federal regulator’s report added to pressure on Wells Fargo and suggested that the bank will have to set aside more money to pay back customers it harmed.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal regulator criticized Wells Fargo for engaging in unfair and deceptive practices and failing to manage risks, and said it had not set aside enough money to pay back the customers it harmed.

articles.headline: After Video Refutes Kelly’s Charges, Congresswoman Raises Issue of Race
articles.snippet: Representative Frederica S. Wilson said John F. Kelly, the president’s chief of staff, lied by suggesting she had taken credit for obtaining funding for a federal building in Miami.
articles.abstract: Representative Frederica S. Wilson said John F. Kelly, the president’s chief of staff, lied by suggesting she had taken credit for obtaining funding for a federal building in Miami.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Video of a 2015 speech delivered by Representative Frederica S. Wilson revealed Friday that John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, misrepresented her remarks when he accused her of bragging about securing $20 million for a South Florida F.B.I. building and twisting President Barack Obama’s arm.
articles.byline: By Yamiche Alcindor and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Barcelona: A Global City in the Eye of a Separatist Storm
articles.snippet: The question of Catalan independence has proved a more complex question for those in Barcelona than for Catalans living outside the regional capital.
articles.abstract: The question of Catalan independence has proved a more complex question for those in Barcelona than for Catalans living outside the regional capital.
articles.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain — These days, the city of Barcelona wears two hats. And not too comfortably.
